Modules¶

The main modules of Hazma are the particle modules: electron, muon, charged pion, neutral pion, charged kaon and the neutral kaons. Each of these particle modules has two functions decay_spectra and fsr which produce the gamma ray spectra from radiative decays and final state radiation, respectively.

Particles (hazma.particles)¶

Muon (hazma.particles.muon)¶

muon.decay_spectra(eng_gam, eng_mu)¶

Returns the photon spectrum \(dN/dE\) from a muon decay. The dominant contribution is from \(\mu\to e\nu_{e}\nu_{\mu}\gamma\).

Parameters:
  • eng_gam (float or numpy.ndarray) – A float or numpy.ndarray containing gamma ray energy(ies) to evaluate the spectrum.
  • eng_mu (float) – Energy of the muon.
Returns:

Returns the spectrum evaluated at (eng_gam, eng_mu).
Return type:

float or numpy.ndarray
muon.fsr(eng_gam, eng_mu, mediator)¶

Returns the photon spectrum \(dN/dE\) from muon final state radiation given a mediator \(M\): \(M^{*}\to\mu^{+}\mu^{-}\gamma\).

Parameters:
  • eng_gam (float or numpy.ndarray) – A float or numpy.ndarray containing gamma ray energy(ies) to evaluate the spectrum.
  • eng_mu (float) – Energy of the muon.
  • mediator (str) – Mediator type: ‘scalar’, ‘pseudo-scalar’, ‘vector’, ‘axial-vector’
Returns:

Returns the spectrum evaluated at (eng_gam, eng_mu).
Return type:

float or numpy.ndarray
